fields.label: Analysis Name
fields.requiredMessage: Please enter name for your app session.

fields.label: Select loci set
fields.helpText: The loci set contains all loci that will be analyzed together with their primers, and period number in case of STR loci. Merge your loci.csv file with MyFLhub if it is not here.

fields.label: or copy paste loci.csv file here
fields.helpText: If you do not want your loci.csv to go public on MyFLhub, paste it here. There cannot be any spaces around ','. Spaces should only be at the end of lines.

fields.label: Select allele database
fields.helpText: The allele database should contain all known alleles for the loci in loci set. Merge your alleles.csv file with MyFLhub if it is not here

fields.label: or copy paste alleles.csv file here
fields.helpText: If you do not want your alleles.csv to go public on MyFLhub, paste it here. There cannot be any spaces around ','. Spaces should only be at the end of lines.

fields.label: General options
fields.helpText: Select the options for the analysis.

fields.label: Threshold (%)
fields.helpText: Unique reads with an abundance lower than this value (in %), are discarded. It is reported how many reads were discarded in this way.

fields.label: Preview (%)
fields.helpText: Select a random percentage of the file to analyze. For low values, this will give you a quick preview of the profile.

fields.label: Primer buffer
fields.helpText: The number of bases at the end of the primer that will not be used for assigning the reads to loci. Choosing a higher buffer therefore means the locus assignment could be slightly less specific, but more reads will get assigned.

fields.label: Stutter buffer
fields.helpText: The stutters of the smallest allele for a locus are normally not in the database. Default value of this buffer is 1 to accomodate that. This allows all stutters to be seen as flanking out is performed with a flank 1 repeat unit smaller.

fields.label: Flankout
fields.helpText: If you see a large amount of negative reads in the analysis, or a high abundant unique read with very poor flanks, turn this feature off. The analysis will then be done between the primers. Previously unknown alleles can be discovered this way.

fields.label: Homopolymers compressed
fields.helpText: Long homopolymers in the flanks could stutter during PCR. This option annotates flanks of loci that were possibly affected by this.

fields.label: Flankout by alignment
fields.helpText: If this option is activated, flanks are removed with our alignment algorithm, instead of the k-mer based flexible flanking.
